channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: House Speaker vote puts GOP unity to the test
item.description: The first order of business for the House this year is to elect a speaker but divisions within the GOP are already causing drama for the current speak...

item.title: An aspiring nurse, a football star, a single mother and a father of 2 killed in New Orleans attack
item.description: Officials have not yet released the names of the 14 people killed in the New Orleans New Year's Day truck attack, but their families and friends have ...

item.title: Biden blocks U.S. Steel's sale to Nippon, citing national security concerns
item.description: The move wasn't unexpected despite efforts by the Japanese government to persuade the Biden administration to approve the sale.

item.title: Gold prices are climbing once again. What gold assets should I invest in now?
item.description: After weeks of price dips, the price of gold is on an upswing, so investing in certain assets could pay off.

item.title: Biden to visit New Orleans Monday, in wake of Bourbon Street attack
item.description: President Biden and first lady Jill Biden will meet with families and community members during their visit, the White House said.

item.title: The victims of the deadly New Orleans truck attack
US top doctor calls for cancer warnings on alcohol
item.description: Surgeon General Vivek Murthy says warning labels should be updated to increase awareness of links to seven types of cancer.

item.title: New to the U.S.: How migrants are building new lives in America
item.description: CBS News reporters from around the country set out to meet people who are new to the U.S., to find out what motivated their travels, how they are assi...

item.title: New Orleans inches toward normalcy while mourning victims of deadly New Year’s rampage
item.description: Street performers and football fans returned to New Orleans streets as the city inched back toward normalcy.

item.title: Why is it so hard to arrest South Korea's impeached president?
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol has been impeached by parliament and suspended from office.

item.title: Cutting out alcohol for Dry January? These apps can help
item.description: If you've resolved to quit drinking for the month, a little technological assistance may be the key to sticking to your goal.

item.title: Biden blocks Japan's Nippon Steel from buying US Steel
item.description: Biden decided to scrap the deal despite concerns that it could damage Washington's relations with Tokyo.

item.title: Israel confirms it is holding Gaza hospital chief Abu Safiya
item.description: The IDF had earlier told a local NGO it was unaware of his case, sparking concern.

item.title: Tuberculosis rates plunge when families living in poverty get a monthly cash payout
item.description: A program in Brazil that give a monthly cash sum to families living in poverty has an unexpected — and welcome result. A new study shows that it is dr...

item.title: Jan 3: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: The House will meet today and hold its election for speaker, with current Speaker Mike Johnson hoping to retain his gavel; Hollywood's award season ki...

item.title: Apple to pay $95m to settle Siri 'listening' lawsuit
item.description: The tech giant denies wrongdoing after being accused of eavesdropping on customers.

item.title: These airlines were the most on time in 2024, analysis finds
item.description: Delta ranked highest among U.S. carriers despite a computer outage​ in July that caused thousands of cancellations.

item.title: An Army veteran’s path to radicalization followed divorces and struggling businesses in Texas
